properties.headline: Tornado Warning issued January 10 at 5:58PM CST until January 10 at 6:15PM CST by NWS Fort Worth TX
properties.description:
At 557 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm with a history of producing a
tornado was located over Crowley, moving northeast at 35 mph.

HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail.

SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation.

IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without
shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage
to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur.  Tree damage is
likely.

This dangerous storm will be near...
Rendon around 605 PM CST.
Forest Hill and Kennedale around 610 PM CST.
Mansfield around 615 PM CST.
Fort Worth and Arlington around 630 PM CST.

Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include
Briaroaks.
properties.instruction:
TAKE COVER NOW! Move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a
sturdy building and avoid windows. If you are outdoors or in a
vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself
from flying debris.

Motorists should not take shelter under highway overpasses. If you
cannot safely drive away from the tornado, as a last resort, either
park your vehicle and stay put, or abandon your vehicle and lie down
in a low lying area and protect yourself from flying debris.

NWSheadline: A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CST FOR NORTH CENTRAL JOHNSON AND SOUTHEASTERN TARRANT COUNTIES
